body:
The issue was that RandomSampler was using `LongTensors` as an index to the dataset. The Variable and Tensor merge had the effect that indexing a 1-d LongTensor return a 0-d (scalar) LongTensor instead of a number. The 0-d tensor was much slower to serialize.

The other part of the fix was this line:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/5225/files/e22441c7d8edd20473033ec8d50e657604b33d02#diff-b8821844d3c39c6b229d352972c72019R50

The change to RandomSampler is probably sufficient. We could probably remove this `int()` call.
body_html:
The issue was that RandomSampler was using LongTensors as an index to the dataset. The Variable and Tensor merge had the effect that indexing a 1-d LongTensor return a 0-d (scalar) LongTensor instead of a number. The 0-d tensor was much slower to serialize.

The other part of the fix was this line:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/5225/files/e22441c7d8edd20473033ec8d50e657604b33d02#diff-b8821844d3c39c6b229d352972c72019R50

The change to RandomSampler is probably sufficient. We could probably remove this int() call.
body_text:
The issue was that RandomSampler was using LongTensors as an index to the dataset. The Variable and Tensor merge had the effect that indexing a 1-d LongTensor return a 0-d (scalar) LongTensor instead of a number. The 0-d tensor was much slower to serialize.
The other part of the fix was this line:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/5225/files/e22441c7d8edd20473033ec8d50e657604b33d02#diff-b8821844d3c39c6b229d352972c72019R50
The change to RandomSampler is probably sufficient. We could probably remove this int() call.
